WRITING.TITLE: Who comes out of the East now?
How many teams do you honestly think have a chance of winning the NBA Championship this year? (and list them)
WRITING.TEXT: Give us a number and a list. Feel free to explain your answer.

WRITING.TITLE: What's been the biggest offseason story so far?
Which ONE team is your rival and why? (no ties, runner ups, also rans, second tiers, etc) Just one rival. Name them and tell us why they're your rival.
WRITING.TEXT: You may not select your own team. You may downvote those who can't follow instructions.

WRITING.TITLE: Who is your dark horse Super Bowl winner for the upcoming season?
WRITING.TEXT: ...and why? Let's keep it to NFL teams only.

WRITING.TITLE: Best miniature golf in the Indy area?
WRITING.TEXT: Mini golf and gelato is my go-to first date combo.

WRITING.TITLE: Best Italian food in the Indy area?
WRITING.TEXT: Feel free to go into detail of your favorite Italian dishes at the restuarants, the ambiance, if you've had real Italian food in Italy before, etc, etc.

WRITING.TITLE: 1980's Taco Bell commercial starring William H. Macy (with voice over by Fred Gwynne)
Which Indy area restaurants have the best paella?
WRITING.TEXT: Please tell us about the type of paella, vegetarian or not, etc. Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: Which Indy area restaurants have the best coleslaw?
WRITING.TEXT: Be sure to describe the slaw for us (creamy, vinegary, etc). Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: What's overrated in the Indy area?
WRITING.TEXT: Restaurants, museums, residential areas, sights, parks, bars, schools, media outlets, stores, people, etc, etc. Feel free to explain why you think it's overrated. Have fun!

WRITING.TITLE: Who are the best bartenders in the Indy area?
WRITING.TEXT: Please mention where they tend bar. Keep in mind we're not talking about the best bar... just the best tenders. And not the best chicken tenders. That was a different post.

WRITING.TITLE: Which restaurants serve the best chicken tenders in the Indy area?
WRITING.TEXT: Feel free to describe them as well.

WRITING.TITLE: Which are the best buffets, brunches, and/or all-you-can eat places in the Indy area?
WRITING.TEXT:
There are some obvious gems like Sushi Club, Edelweiss' buffet days, Spice Nation, etc. Curious as to which others you guys know about, love, etc.
Edit: Feel free to share pertinent details such as what they offer, if only certain days/times, if it is all-you-can-eat, vegan, price, etc. (if you happen to know them)

WRITING.TITLE: What do you dislike about /r/nfl? And how would you fix it?
WRITING.TEXT:
For instance, the bias toward particular teams, downvoting trends, etc.
